meanings.definition: The quality of being authoritative or having authority.
meanings.sent1: Her authoritativeness in the meeting made everyone listen to her.
meanings.sent2: The authoritativeness of the principal ensured discipline in the school.
meanings.sent3: His authoritativeness in choosing ice cream flavors was comical.
meanings.sent4: The authoritativeness of the lion in the jungle was unquestionable.
meanings.sent5: The authoritativeness of the judge's voice echoed in the courtroom.

meanings.definition: The power to influence or command thought, opinion, or behavior.
meanings.sent1: The authoritativeness of the advertisement persuaded many to buy the product.
meanings.sent2: She spoke with authoritativeness, convincing others to join the cause.
meanings.sent3: The authoritativeness of the toddler's demands was amusing to the family.
meanings.sent4: His authoritativeness over the team was like a captain of a ship.
meanings.sent5: The authoritativeness of the CEO's speech left a lasting impact on the employees.
